title: Hall-type theorems for hypergraphs
summary: In the mathematical field of graph theory, Hall-type theorems for hypergraphs are several generalizations of Hall's marriage theorem from graphs to hypergraphs. Such theorems were proved by Ofra Kessler,[1][2] Ron Aharoni,[3][4] Penny Haxell,[5][6] Roy Meshulam,[7] and others.
